full_text: 2017/KER/49755 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA FRIDAY, THE 8TH DAY OF DECEMBER 2017/17TH AGRAHAYANA, 1939 Cri.MC.No. 4248 of 2017 () CC 454/2017 of JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, TRIPUNITHURA CRIME NO. 1588/2015 OF HILL PALACE POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT PETITIONER/ACCUSED NOS.1 & 4: 1. BINOY GEORGE,AGED 48 YEARS, S/O.GEORGE, PRESENTLY RESIDING AT CHERUKARA HOUSE, EROOR WEST P.O., TRIPUNITHURA, EERNAKULAM DISTRICT. 2. SHEEJA @ SHEEJAMOL, AGED 41 YEARS, W/O.BINOY GEORGE, PRESENTLY RESIDING AT CHERUKARA HOUSE, EROOR WEST PO., TRIPUNITHURA, EERNAKULAM DISTRICT. BY ADVS.SRI.P.VIJAYA BHANU (SR.) SRILM.REVIKRISHNAN SRI.C.JAYAKIRAN RESPONDENTS : 1. MANJU SHINE @ MANJULA @ MARY, AGED 37 YEARS, D/O.LATE M.X.MATHEW, W/O.SHINE VARGHESE, PRESENTLY RESIDING AT CHITTEZHATH HOUSE MULANTHURUTHY VILLAGE, PULIKKAMLI P.O., KARIKODE DESOM, KANAYANNUR TALUK, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, PIN-682314. 2. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. R1 BY ADVS. SRILN.SUBRAMANIAM SRI.M.S.NARAYANAN SRI.P.TGIRIJAN SMT.USHA NARAYANAN R2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.C.S.HRITWICK THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 08-12-2017 ALONG WITH CRL.M.C.8435/2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: bp 2017/KER/49755 Cri.MC.No. 4248 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE A:- TRUE COPY OF THE PRIVATE COMPLAINT PREFERRED BY THE 1ST RESPONDENT HEREIN BEFORE THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF THE FIRST CLASS, TRIPUNITHURA. ANNEXURE B:- TRUE COPY OF THE F.LR. IN CRIME NO.1588 OF 2015 OF HILL PALACE POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM CITY. ANNEXURE C:- TRUE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.1588 OF 2015 OF HILL PALACE POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM CITY. ANNEXURE D:- TRUE COPY OF TG6HE PLAINT IN O.S.NO.374 OF 2015 PENDING ON THE FILES OF THE MUNSIFF COURT, ERNAKULAM. ANNEXURE 3:- TRUE COPY OF THE WRITTEN STATEMENT SUBMITTED BY DEFENDANT NO.2 (ACCUSED NO.3 IN THE INSTANT CASE) IN 0.S.N0.374 OF 2015 PENDING ON THE FILES OF THE MUNSIFF COURT, ERNAKULAM. RESPONDENT(S)' EXHIBITS : NIL. HTRUE COPY// PA. TO JUDGE bp pete DO17IKERIHITSS B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 8" day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioners are the accused in CC No.454/2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thripunithura, which has arisen from Crime No.1588/2015 of Hill Palace Police Station for the offences punishable under Sections 120B, 406, 419, 420, 424, 465, 468 and 471 read with Section 34 IPC. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the petitioners in Cri.M.C.4248/2017 and the de facto complainant in mediation and the mediation settlement agreement entered into between them is produced. In Crl.M.C.8435/2017, the de facto complainant has filed Annexure-B affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between her and the petitioners and presently, she has no complaints against the petitioners. pete DO17IKERIHITSS Crl.M.C.4248&8435/2017 >. 3. When the matter is amicably settled between the parties, no purpose would be served in proceeding with the maiter further. Matters being so, all further proceedings against the petitioners in CC No.454/2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thripunithura, which has arisen from Crime No.1588/2015 of Hill Palace Police Station, can be quashed. In the result, these Crl.M.Cs. are allowed and all further proceedings against the petitioners in CC No.454/2017 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thripunithura, which has arisen from Crime No.1588/2015 of Hill Palace Police Station, are quashed. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/08/12 // True Copy // PS to Judge
